products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-event-streams
products.label: Cloud automation for Event Streams
products.short_description: Automates provisioning and configuration of IBM Event Streams instance on IBM Cloud for building secure, scalable, and event-driven cloud-native applications.
products.long_description: This solution deploys and configures [IBM Cloud® Event Streams](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-getting-started), a fully managed, high-throughput message bus built on Apache Kafka. It supports real-time event ingestion and distribution across services and applications in IBM Cloud®. It supports provisioning the Event Streams instance and configuring Kafka topics, schemas, and quotas. It also enables mirroring of topics for high availability and disaster recovery. Additionally, it supports the creation of context-based restriction (CBR) rules for fine-grained access control. Data encryption is enforced through IBM Key Protect or Hyper Protect Crypto Services, ensuring data protection. This architecture is designed to provide a production-ready, scalable Kafka environment optimized for event-driven workloads in IBM Cloud®.

features.title: Topics
features.description: Create and manage [topics](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-apache_kafka#kafka_topics_partitions) to organize your event streams. Customize partitions, retention, and configurations to optimize data flow and message durability.

features.title: Metrics
features.description: Monitor your Event Streams instance with [metrics](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-getting-started-metrics) on throughput, latency, partition usage, and more. Use these insights to maintain performance and quickly detect issues.

features.title: Quotas
features.description: Set [quotas](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-kafka_quotas) to manage client resource usage and ensure fair access. Prevent overloads by controlling bandwidth and partition consumption per application or user.

features.title: Mirroring
features.description: Enable [mirroring](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-mirroring_setup) to replicate topics and consumer group offsets between clusters. Use this for disaster recovery, high availability, or multi-region deployments.

features.title: Schemas
features.description: Leverage the [Schema Registry](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-ES_schema_registry#ES_overview) (Enterprise plan) to register, manage, and validate message schemas. Enforce compatibility and data quality across producers and consumers.

features.title: KMS Encryption
features.description: Supports [customer-managed encryption](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-managing_encryption) with the following IBM Cloud® key management services

features.title: Sets up account configuration for the Event Streams instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Account Configuration to organize your Event Streams instance in your IBM Cloud account. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/account?topic=account-overview)

features.title: Sets up secrets management for the Event Streams instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy IBM Cloud Secrets Manager to securely store Event Streams credentials. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-getting-started)

features.title: Sets up logging for the Event Streams instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Cloud Logs to route, alert, and visualize platform logs that are generated by your Event Streams instance. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-streaming_data_cloud_logs)

features.title: Sets up monitoring operational metrics for the Event Streams instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Cloud Monitoring to measure how users and applications interact with your Event Streams instance. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-metrics)

features.title: Sets up activity tracking for the Event Streams instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Activity Tracker Event Routing to route and securely store auditing events that are related to your Event Streams instance. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/EventStreams?topic=EventStreams-at_events)

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, as such support is handled through the originated repo. If you experience issues please open an issue in the repository [https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-event-streams/issues](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-event-streams/issues). Please note this product is not supported via the IBM Cloud Support Center.

architecture.descriptions: This architecture supports provisioning and configuring quickstart Event Streams.

features.title: Quickstart variation
features.description: Configured to use an Event Streams instance with either the lite or standard plan, including Kafka topics and optional add-on integrations, editable to fit your use case..

diagrams.description:
This architecture supports provisioning and configuring IBM Cloud® Event Streams:

- Provisions an Event Streams instance using either the lite or standard plan.
- Creates Kafka topics as part of the deployment.
  - Lite plan supports a single topic.
  - Standard plan supports multiple topics.

This modular design helps you build event-driven applications with a fully managed Kafka service on IBM Cloud®.

configuration.description: When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance will be configured to collect platform metrics from the provided region. You can configure 1 instance only of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance has already been configured. You may not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).

features.title: Security enforced variation
features.description: Configured to use an Event Streams instance, secure-by-default with the enterprise plan, including Kafka topics, schema registry, KMS encryption, CBR rules, quotas, mirroring; editable to fit your use case.

diagrams.description:
- Provisions a security enforced IBM Cloud® Event Streams environment.
- Supports creation of Kafka topics, schema registries, metrics, and mirroring features.
- Deploys resources within a defined region and resource group.
- Enables customer-managed encryption using IBM Key Protect or Hyper Protect Crypto Services.
- Allows use of an existing Key Management Services (KMS) instance and keys.
- Supports Context-Based Restrictions (CBRs) to enforce secure access policies.
- Provides a secure, event-driven messaging infrastructure on IBM Cloud.
